channel.title: [PI] 2 worlds! H3LP!
channel.description: OK guys I have made 2 worlds using 2 batch files one on port 5555 and other on 43594 using the same character files. Well the problem is that i can log into both worlds using the same char at the same time. How can I resolve this problem. Thank you, all help is appreicated. And goodluck for people trying to solve this.

item.title: [PI] 2 worlds! H3LP!
item.dc:creator: @Harvi Harvi
item.description:
@Harvi wrote:

how would i do that

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] 2 worlds! H3LP!
item.dc:creator: @imstrength imstrength
item.description:
@imstrength wrote:

The Web Guy:

It sounds like you’d want to combine the batch files and have one batch file which launches two servers, just on different ports. You’ll want to integrate the two worlds more for this to work. Basically, you’ll need to have the world on port 5555 and the world on port 43594 work together, so if someone logs in on port 5555, it sends it to another batch file, which is used for keeping track of who is online or offline. Then the port 43594 if someone logs on, have it check the third batch file before proceeding.

yeah thats basically what i meant except its based out of the batch not server-sided

Read full topic

Basically, you’ll need to have the world on port 5555 and the world on port 43594 work together, so if someone logs in on port 5555, it sends it to another batch file, which is used for keeping track of who is online or offline. Then the port 43594 if someone logs on, have it check the third batch file before proceeding.

item.title: [PI] 2 worlds! H3LP!
item.dc:creator: @imstrength imstrength
item.description:
@imstrength wrote:

go to your login int and add a check for both ports…

if logging in on port 5555 && logged in on port 43594

break;

if logging in on port 43594 && logged in on port 5555

break;

else

return;

idk i just made a basic like how it would be set up…just too tired to think about it but i figured id give you a reply with a little input…and please let me know if you figure this out
